title: Session Keys
description: Use session keys for batch operations
---

# Session Keys

Enable advanced operation patterns with session keys.

## What are session keys?

Session keys allow your app to perform operations on behalf of users without requiring approval for each one. This enables:

- Batch operations
- Background operations
- Better experience for frequent actions

## Create a session key

```typescript
import { useSmartWallet } from '@varity-labs/ui-kit';

function SessionKeyDemo() {
  const { createSessionKey } = useSmartWallet();

  const handleCreate = async () => {
    const sessionKey = await createSessionKey({
      permissions: ['transfer', 'approve'],
      duration: 3600, // 1 hour
      maxTransactions: 100,
    });

    console.log('Session key:', sessionKey.address);
  };

  return <button onClick={handleCreate}>Create Session Key</button>;
}
```

## Use session key for operations

```typescript
const { sendTransactionWithSession } = useSmartWallet();

// Send multiple operations without user approval
await sendTransactionWithSession([
  { to: '0x...', data: '0x...' },
  { to: '0x...', data: '0x...' },
  { to: '0x...', data: '0x...' },
]);
```

## Session key permissions

| Permission | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| `transfer` | Send tokens |
| `approve` | Approve token spending |
| `execute` | Execute backend calls |
| `*` | All permissions |

## Revoke session keys

```typescript
const { revokeSessionKey } = useSmartWallet();

await revokeSessionKey(sessionKeyAddress);
```
